author: Jack Bamford
title: McCullum Anticipates Full Commitment from Stokes as Englandâ€™s Cricket Coach
text:
Table of Contents
Toggle
McCullumâ€™s Vision for English Cricket New Leadership Structure McCullumâ€™s Trust in Stokes Future Expectations Stokesâ€™ Aspirations McCullumâ€™s Confidence in Team Performance Support for Buttler Looking Ahead Debut for Hull McCullumâ€™s Vision for English Cricket
Brendon McCullum has voiced his expectation that Ben Stokes will be completely dedicated to the England cricket team following the New Zealanderâ€™s contract extension, which now includes the management of both Test and limited-overs formats.
New Leadership Structure After taking the helm as head coach two years ago, McCullum, 42, has made significant changes to Englandâ€™s Test cricket approach. He will now also lead the white-ball teams starting in January.
Stokes, 33, who serves as the Test captain, had previously come out of retirement to participate in the one-day international setup during last yearâ€™s World Cup, although he has not been part of Englandâ€™s white-ball squad since then.
McCullumâ€™s Trust in Stokes Regarding their working relationship, McCullum stated, â€œHeâ€™s been incredible and our relationship is fantastic. You never know where the gameâ€™s going globally and what sort of opportunities will pop up for him, but I know how invested he is in English cricket and how determined he is to drive this team forward.â€
Future Expectations Before McCullumâ€™s recent extension of his contract, there were speculations about both he and Stokes potentially stepping down after the upcoming Ashes series in Australia planned for the winter of 2025-26. However, under the new agreement, McCullum will retain leadership until the home Ashes in the summer of 2027 along with the 50-over World Cup scheduled for later that year.
His tenure will see him involved in the Champions Trophy early in the coming year and a T20 World Cup in 2026.
Stokesâ€™ Aspirations In a recent interview with the Telegraph, Stokes expressed that â€œin an ideal worldâ€ he would still hold the position of Test captain in 2027, indicating that he finds it challenging to decline participation in global tournaments.
McCullumâ€™s Confidence in Team Performance In anticipation of the upcoming Test match against Sri Lanka at the Kia Oval, McCullum remarked, â€œThe skipper and I havenâ€™t spoken, but Iâ€™m assuming heâ€™s all in. He seems like that sort of bloke.â€ He further expressed confidence in Stokesâ€™ ability to thrive in high-pressure situations.
Support for Buttler McCullum also affirmed his support for Jos Buttler as Englandâ€™s white-ball captain, despite a tough year that culminated in the departure of coach Matthew Mott. Despite Englandâ€™s recent struggles, having lost significantly in the 50-over World Cup and semi-finals of the T20 World Cup, McCullum remains optimistic about Buttlerâ€™s contributions.
He described Buttlerâ€™s demeanor as occasionally â€œa little bit miserable at times,â€ urging him to enjoy the forthcoming years and seize the opportunity to lead a talented group of players.
Looking Ahead With the packed schedule for Englandâ€™s cricket team, McCullum indicated that he would miss some series, delegating responsibilities to assistant coaches while balancing time with his family in New Zealand.
Having achieved victories in all five Tests this summer, England is aiming for a clean sweep against Sri Lanka this weekâ€”a feat they havenâ€™t accomplished since 2004.
Debut for Hull The team is set to introduce Leicestershireâ€™s left-arm bowler Josh Hull, selecting him based on potential despite a challenging domestic record. McCullum noted, â€œWhat we are trying to achieve is bringing in some of these guys who we see as rough diamonds with incredibly high ceilings.â€
Despite uncertainty regarding the schedule for their upcoming Tests in Pakistan, McCullum expressed hope for clarity soon so that team selections can proceed smoothly.

author: Citizen Reporter
title: Archbishop Ole Sapit condemns deployment of Kenyan troops to Haiti
text:
By Boniface Barasa, Anglican Archbishop Jackson Ole Sapit has faulted President William Ruto's push to send Kenya's police officers to Haiti.
The Archbishop says the move is ill-informed as residents of the northern parts of the country continue to grapple with insecurity.
"It doesn't make sense to send troops to Haiti when we have insecurity problems across the country and especially in the North Rift. Our request is that as the government send troops to Haiti, they should also better security across Kenya.," said Ole Sapit.
The majority of the residents in the area who fled their homes for safety continue to grapple with a deplorable state at IDP camps in Lolmolog, Longewan, and Ang'ata Nanyekie.
The archbishop, who is on a working tour of Samburu County, and local leaders from the area want the insecurity in the North Rift region put to an end before the government commits the country's security personnel to Haiti.
Philip Lerno, Loosuk area chief of Samburu West Sub County, says there's still tension, with bandits spotted in the area from time to time.
Bandits are still active in the area. It's the National Police Reservists (NPR) who are keeping them at bay but tension is still high in the region since they can decide to strike at any time," Lerno said.
On Friday, President William Ruto once again defended Kenya's commitment to deploy 1,000 police officers to Port-au-Prince as part of the U.N. Security Council-backed security mission to troubled Haiti.
Addressing the press alongside U.S. President Joe Biden at the White House in Washington D.C. on Thursday, Citizen TV's Ayub Abdikadir pressed Ruto to explain Kenya's decision to dispatch the officers to Haiti, a distance of 12,078 kilometres from Kenya, amidst ongoing banditry attacks in the North Rift region.
In response, Ruto highlighted that despite dispatching troops to Haiti, Kenya has remained steadfast in addressing the issue of banditry back home, adding that the government has deployed 3,000 military personnel and 2,000 police officers to the North Rift to combat and eliminate the banditry menace.
"I made a commitment to the people of Kenya to sort out insecurity in the North Rift. I have followed that with action. As we speak there are 3,000 military officers and 2,000 police officers in the North Rift," said Ruto.
"We have also renovated 15 schools and reopened 20 schools that were closed. The exercise is still ongoing."
Ruto subsequently emphasised Kenya's role in enhancing security within its borders while affirming the country's broader responsibility to do the same beyond its borders.
"We have made tremendous progress in making sure that we create security at home but that does not take away our responsibility. Even as we deployed troops and police to sort out the banditry problem we still deployed 1,000 troops to DRC Congo because that is our neighbour," he said.
"We have deployed 5,000 troops in Somalia because that is equally our responsibility and Haiti should not be an exception. Deploying 1,000 troops to Haiti speaks of the same belief and commitment."
Tags: Citizen Digital Haiti William Ruto Banditry Archbishop Jackson Ole Sapit Want to send us a story? SMS to 25170 or WhatsApp 0743570000 or Submit on Citizen Digital or email wananchi@royalmedia.co.ke

author: MileageWise - Reconstructing mileage logs
title: Forget Mileage Tracking Headaches: MileageWises IRS-Proof Logs Have Your Back!
text: Forget Mileage Tracking Headaches: MileageWises IRS-Proof Logs Have Your Back! MileageWise has updated its mileage app to provide tracking mileage for taxes to new customers and old alike. Further information can be found at https://www.mileagewise.com/. (firmenpresse) - MileageWise has introduced a new element to its mileage app, designed to track mileage for taxes, benefiting both new and existing customers by reducing the time needed to create their mileage logbook. To the delight of many, individuals who own and operate small businesses, often with a few employees, and are looking for a mobile app to track mileage can now take advantage of this new offering from MileageWise. The release has now been officially announced. This update delivers IRS-compliant mileage logs to customers, interested parties, and those active within the small business and gig worker communities. MileageWise achieves this by incorporating the new IRS guidelines, even when creating retrospective logs, ensuring compliance no matter which year the logs are generated for. MileageWise is excited to unveil this latest benefit for both current and new app users, specifically designed to enhance the user experience and better meet the needs of small business owners. Gary Csizmadia, Head of Sales at MileageWise, provided further insight, saying: â€œThe IRS-proof mileage log feature of MileageWise gives peace of mind to anyone needing to track business mileage. You donâ€™t have to worry about missed trips or inaccuracies, which can be stressful when preparing taxes or facing an audit. The IRS requires detailed and accurate logs, and any gaps or discrepancies could lead to fines or denied deductions. MileageWise uses AI to check and correct up to 70 logical conflicts, ensuring your log is bulletproof. One of the coolest features is retrospective log creation. If you missed logging trips, the AI Wizard steps in, using patterns from your past driving history and data from Google Timeline to reconstruct those trips. This not only saves time but also boosts the accuracy of your log. So, even if youâ€™ve forgotten to track a few drives, thereâ€™s no need to worry. Another important point is the tool's versatility. Whether you're a small business owner, a gig worker, or someone managing a team of drivers, MileageWise tailors the experience to suit your needs. This isnâ€™t just for freelancersâ€”itâ€™s a powerful tool for any business that depends on accurate mileage logs for tax deductions and reimbursements." MileageWise places a strong emphasis on listening to customers and incorporating feedback wherever possible. This approach helps address issues like missed trips, IRS compliance, and seamless expense tracking. MileageWise aims to save users significant time and effort in managing mileage logs through AI-powered trip tracking, gap-filling, and automated reporting, especially in the small business and gig worker markets. Currently, MileageWise is recognized as a strong, reliable solution in the mileage tracking market, particularly praised for its IRS-proof logs, automated tracking, and its innovative AI Wizard feature. This AI technology allows users to retroactively create and complete mileage logs, filling gaps and ensuring compliance. Itâ€™s especially valued by small business owners, self-employed individuals, gig workers, and employers managing teams who need accurate mileage records for tax deductions and reimbursements. Gary Csizmadia is immensely proud of the business, which has been operational for 4 years, and the loyal following of fans and customers they've built. Interested parties who would like to experience MileageWiseâ€™s mobile app for tracking mileage are encouraged to visit the website at https://www.mileagewise.com/ for full details and to get started. author: VNExplorer
title: Ireland New Yearâ€™s weather misery as Met Eireann issues multiple warnings for fierce double blast
text:
10/12/23 â€“ People walk through a city centre during rain showers
A deluge of wet and windy weather is set to be unleashed across Ireland, as the New Yearâ€™s celebrations get off to a stormy start.
Miserable conditions loom as powerful systems from the Atlantic barrel towards Ireland, ready to make landfall and sweep the country in the coming days.
Met EIreann has issued multiple weather warnings ahead of a double blast of wind and rain.
A Status Yellow rainfall warning is in place until 9pm Friday for Donegal, Leitrim, North Mayo and Sligo. It warns that â€œheavy rainfall may lead to localised floodingâ€.
A few hours later, another Status Yellow warning for both wind and rain kicks in for Clare, Cork, Kerry, Limerick, Waterford, Galway, Mayo and Wexford. The alert, which is in place from 2am until 11pm on Saturday, states: â€œSouthwest winds will be strong and gusty at times coupled with heavy rain and thundery showers.Potential impacts include surface flooding, wave overtopping, loose debris, objects displaced and difficult travelling conditions.â€
After that, a third Status Yellow warning for wind has been issued from 11pm Saturday until 5pm Sunday (New Yearâ€™s Eve) for Clare, Cork, Kerry and Limerick. The alert reads: â€œWesterly winds veering northwesterly will be strong and gusty at times. Potential Impacts include loose debris, objects displaced, difficult travelling conditions, waving overtopping.â€
The weather is expected to continue unsettled with rain or showers most days.
Giving the forecast for the final days of 2023, Met Eireann said: â€œCloudy periods and some sunny spells Friday along with some scattered showers, some of which will be heavy with hail, especially in the north. Some localised flooding possible in northern counties. Highest temperatures of 5C to 8C in fresh and gusty westerly breezes.
â€œSome clear spells at first tonight with just isolated showers. Lowest temperatures of -1C to 3C with some frost and icy stretches forming with light breezes. However, cloud will build from the southwest, turning milder as the rain follows, extending northeastwards over much of the country by morning, accompanied by fresh to strong and gusty southeasterly winds. There is a chance of transient falls of sleet on the leading edge of the rain.
â€œA wet and windy start to Saturday with widespread rain, heavy or thundery at times with some localised flooding possible. The rain will clear from the west to sunny spells and showers from the western half of the country through the morning, extending to all areas in the afternoon. Some showers will be heavy with a chance of isolated thunderstorms and hail. Highest afternoon temperatures of 5C to 9C, coolest in the northwest. Fresh to strong and gusty southerly winds, with onshore gales, will mean there is a chance of coastal flooding in the south and southwest.
â€œClear spells and squally showers overnight Saturday, most frequent in the west and southwest. Lowest temperatures of 3 to 6 degrees in fresh to strong and gusty southerly or cyclonic variable winds.â€
Looking ahead to New Yearâ€™s Eve, the national forecaster said: â€œBreezy or windy with sunny spells and scattered showers and a chance of hail on Sunday. Fresh to strong and gusty westerly or cyclonic variable winds will gradually decrease moderate to fresh and gusty through the day. Highest temperatures of 5C to 8C generally.
â€œShowers will continue overnight, mainly for Atlantic counties with longer spells of rain possible in the northwest. Some frost or ice will form with lowest temperatures of -1C to 3C degrees in mostly moderate westerly winds.â€
The forecast for New Yearâ€™s Day reads: â€œSunny spells and scattered showers at first Monday, becoming more isolated through the morning and early afternoon. Cloud will build from the southwest with rain following, extending northeastwards over much of the country by night-time. Highest afternoon temperatures of 5C to 8C in light to moderate southwesterly winds, backing southeasterly and increasing moderate to fresh with the rain.
â€œOutbreaks of rain will clear northwards from most areas overnight Monday, with clear spells and scattered showers following from the west. Lowest temperatures over the northern half of the country of -2C to 0C, milder further south.â€
Looking further ahead, the meteorological agency said: â€œCurrent indications suggest that on Tuesday there will be further showers or showery outbreaks of rain. Highest temperatures of 6C to 9C generally.
â€œThe rest of next week looks generally cool and unsettled with rain or showers expected. Highest temperatures generally ranging from 6C to 8C.â€

We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you donâ€™t like our community, you can check out any time you like. author: Sunil Dhawan
title: H-2B visa cap for foreign workers for second half of FY 2025 exhausted
text:
U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) has received enough petitions to meet the congressionally establishedâ€¯H-2B capâ€¯for the second half of FY 2025. March 5, 2025, was the final receipt date for new cap-subject H-2B worker petitions requesting an employment start date on or after April 1, 2025, and before October 1, 2025.
All the new cap-subject H-2B petitions received after March 5, 2025, that request an employment start date on or after April 1, 2025, and before October 1, 2025, will be rejected by USCIS.
However, the filing dates for supplemental H-2B visas for the remainder of FY 2025 are now available. Currently, Congress has set the H-2B cap at 66,000 per fiscal year, with 33,000 for workers who begin employment in the first half of the fiscal year (Oct. 1 â€“ Mar. 31) and 33,000 for workers who begin employment in the second half of the fiscal year (Apr. 1â€”Sep. 30).
In November 2024, the US announced that it expects to make an additional 64,716 H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas available for Fiscal Year (FY) 2025. The additional H-2B visas will be in addition to the congressionally mandated 66,000 H-2B visas that are available each fiscal year.
On December 2, 2024, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Labor (DOL) jointly published a temporary final rule increasing the numerical limit (or cap) on H-2B nonimmigrant visas by up to 64,716 additional visas for all of fiscal year 2025.
These supplemental visas are available only to U.S. businesses that are suffering irreparable harm or will suffer impending irreparable harm without the ability to employ all the H-2B workers requested in their petition, as attested by the employer on a new attestation form.
In January 2025, USCIS announced that it has received enough petitions to reach the cap for the additional 20,716 H-2B visas made available for returning workers for the first half of fiscal year 2025 with start dates on or before March 31, 2025, under the H-2B supplemental cap temporary final rule for financial year 2025.
The H-2Bâ€¯program allows U.S. employers who meet specific regulatory requirements to bring foreign nationals to the United States to fill temporary nonagricultural jobs.
Congress created the H-2B non-agricultural temporary worker program to allow U.S. employers to bring foreign workers to the United States to fill temporary non-agricultural jobs.
The maximum period of stay in the H-2B classification is three years. A person who has held H-2B nonimmigrant status for a total of three years must depart and remain outside of the United States for an uninterrupted period of three months before seeking readmission as an H-2B nonimmigrant.
The new regulation simplifies the H-2B program worker stay restrictions by eliminating â€œinterruptedâ€ stay provisions and establishing a consistent 60-day absence time to reset the 3-year clock. This implies that an H-2 worker can now seek new eligible employment or prepare to leave the United States for up to 60 days after their employment ends without violating their H-2 status or accruing unlawful presence.
The regulation would divide the supplemental visas for returning workers between the first and second halves of the fiscal year to account for the need for additional seasonal and other temporary workers throughout the year, with a portion of the second half allocation set aside to meet demand during the peak summer season.

author: Diana Sotomayor
title: No todos los padres estÃ¡n conformes con el regreso a las aulas en Guayaquil
text: [Guayaquil] No todos los padres estÃ¡n conformes con el regreso a las aulas en Guayaquil Algunos padres piden repetir el contenido impartido incluso estas semanas, puesto que alegan que se han reportado vacÃ­os en el aprendizaje Era una situaciÃ³n que no deseaban volver a vivir los padres, maestros ni estudiantes. La virtualidad, debido a la violencia que experimenta el paÃ­s, golpeÃ³ nuevamente sin avisar. Y aunque hay planteles que en Guayaquil ya han vuelto al aula, 77 segÃºn anunciÃ³ el Ministerio de EducaciÃ³n; hay otros que desconocen cuÃ¡ndo lo harÃ¡n o si lo harÃ¡n, generando incertidumbre sobre todo a los alumnos que estÃ¡n a solo tres semanas de terminar el aÃ±o escolar. En Playas unos 12.000 estudiantes retornaron a clase presenciales [Leer mÃ¡s](/guayaquil/playas-12-000-estudiantes-retornaron-clase-presenciales-187218) Ellos, como publicÃ³ EXPRESO el pasado 25 de enero, quieren volver para reencontrarse con sus compaÃ±eros. Un acciÃ³n que los padres no aprueban en su totalidad, al preferir que en las tres semanas que resta para culminar el aÃ±o lectivo 2023, terminen de estudiar en casa, aun cuando este escenario complica, en algunos casos, su cotidianidad (Le puede interesar leer: [Un emotivo regreso al aula, entre abrazos y medidas de seguridad](https://www.expreso.ec/guayaquil/emotivo-regreso-aula-abrazos-medidas-seguridad-violencia-187248.html)) AndrÃ©s Lucero, docente y padre de dos menores, habla con EXPRESO sobre los avatares que han surgido a raÃ­z de la virtualidad. â€œEs difÃ­cil, tengo dos hijos y estar pendiente de que se conecten a sus clases y realicen actividades, aumenta mis labores ya que cuando ellos estÃ¡n en sus estudios, no puedo usar la laptop para desarrollar las actividades de la instituciÃ³n donde imparto clases y que no regresarÃ¡ a la presencialidad. Tengo que esperar a que terminen para poder utilizarla, pero mis clases se ven tambiÃ©n afectadasâ€, afirma. Al final del dÃ­a esta incertidumbre de si volvemos o no, nos hace adaptarnos a una modalidad para luego volver a otra. Creo, que lo mejor que puede hacer el Gobierno es tomar una decisiÃ³n final y ahora. Lucero mantiene la postura de que todos deberÃ­an regresar al aula, sin embargo, eso deberÃ­a suceder cuando el Gobierno, y las instituciones den las debidas garantÃ­as de seguridad. SituaciÃ³n que, a decir de los miembros de la UniÃ³n Nacional de Educadores no se cumple. Que la vida de los maestros y alumnos, en algunos puntos del Puerto Principal, estÃ¡n en riesgo, han dicho en reiteradas ocasiones, al argumentar que EducaciÃ³n no ve la realidad que enfrentan ni escucha las sÃºplicas de los educadores que han sido vÃ­ctimas ya de las extorsiones. Â¿Hasta cuÃ¡ndo habrÃ¡ clases en Guayaquil y la Costa? [Leer mÃ¡s](/guayaquil/habra-clases-costa-187186) Teniendo en cuenta esta situaciÃ³n y la ola de violencia que en general se vive en Guayaquil, para el economista Carlos Cevallos, este regreso progresivo que se ha dado no es la medida mÃ¡s idÃ³nea, ya que los estudiantes, ademÃ¡s, se ven afectados por el cambio constante de ambientes. â€œLo que queda del aÃ±o debiÃ³ terminar de forma virtual. Realmente a mÃ­ no me gustarÃ­a que regresen porque no hay muchas garantÃ­as de protecciÃ³n. Es evidente que los grupos armados podrÃ­an atacar los colegios y es innecesario retornar y hacer que muchos jÃ³venes corran peligro. AdemÃ¡s, falta dos o tres semanas para terminar, ya tienen el 90 % de cumplimiento del nivel en curso. Es absurdoâ€, piensa. Realmente no me gustarÃ­a que vuelvan al aula porque no hay mucha seguridad. Si les toca a mis hijos regresar y no le dan seguridad, voy a estar muy preocupado y esperando que terminen las clases del aÃ±o lectivo. Asimismo piensa Andrea RamÃ­rez, abogada y docente particular de Lengua. â€œEl Gobierno deberÃ­a tomar una decisiÃ³n clara para no vivir en incertidumbre. Sobre todo porque eso afecta el cronograma de estudios de los jÃ³venes y tambiÃ©n de los profesionales que vivimos bajo ese calendario. Si ya falta poco debimos haber terminado en la modalidad virtualâ€, alega. El retorno a la presencialidad atemoriza a los universitarios [Leer mÃ¡s](/guayaquil/retorno-presencialidad-atemoriza-universitarios-186899) Carolina Espinoza recibiÃ³ vÃ­a WhatsApp un mensaje en el que se le informÃ³ que sus hijos retornarÃ­an a la presencialidad, y notÃ³ disgusto en el grupo de padres. â€œCreo que tocarÃ¡ repetir el contenido impartido en estas semanas. Mis hijos, pese a ser corto el tiempo que estudiaron a travÃ©s de una computadora, entran a exÃ¡menes con los vacÃ­os de las clases virtuales que fueron irregulares. Estoy algo decepcionada porque regresamos y no hubo cambio en los estudiosâ€, concluye. Es necesario el regreso a la presencialidad, pero solo si el Gobierno y las instituciones nos dan garantÃ­as de seguridad. Igualmente, ya faltan pocas semanas para que termine el aÃ±o lectivo y seguirÃ­amos igual que en lo virtual. - La necesidad de evaluar las necesidades educativas Clases en Ecuador: la presencialidad se retomarÃ¡ de forma progresiva y focalizada [Leer mÃ¡s](/actualidad/clases-ecuador-presencialidad-retomara-forma-progresiva-focalizada-186596) Desde un punto de vista psicolÃ³gico, la presencialidad es generalmente mejor que la educaciÃ³n a distancia en sus diferentes modalidades, aseguran expertos en psicologÃ­a consultados por este Diario. Luiggi SÃ¡enz de Viteri, educador y psicÃ³logo, manifiesta que â€œla presencialidad ofrece una serie de ventajas para el bienestar psicolÃ³gico como mayor interacciÃ³n social, sentido de pertenencia y mÃ¡s motivaciÃ³n por las respuestas mÃ¡s rÃ¡pidas a estÃ­mulosâ€. Sin embargo, tambiÃ©n alude que por la situaciÃ³n que vive el paÃ­s, la virtualidad tambiÃ©n tiene ventajas en la salud mental. â€œEn casos como el conflicto interno armado en Ecuador, la virtualidad es una opciÃ³n con mayor flexibilidad que disminuye la exposiciÃ³n a riesgos y el estrÃ©s. No todos los casos son iguales, por eso se necesita evaluar las necesidades de la poblaciÃ³n y los estudiantesâ€, seÃ±alÃ³. Para leer mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n de este tipo, Â¡ [SUSCRÃBETE AQU](https://suscripcion.expreso.ec/)Ã!

author: Pablo Rubio
title: Explica Sonrixs, novio de canadiense, por quÃ© podrÃ­a perder la movilidad de su mano tras accidente
text:
Explica Sonrixs, novio de canadiense, por quÃ© podrÃ­a perder la movilidad de su mano tras accidente
El tiktoker sufriÃ³ una rutura en su brazo.
OTTAWA, CanadÃ¡ â€” Recientemente, Jorge IvÃ¡n HernÃ¡ndez RamÃ­rez, conocido en [TikTok](https://www.elimparcial.com/tags/tiktok/) como Sonrixs, sufriÃ³ un accidente mientras estaba con su familia, motivo por el que fue hospitalizado de emergencia.
El tiktoker de origen mexicano se hizo popular por sus videos de comedia en las [redes sociales](https://www.elimparcial.com/tags/redes-sociales/), su carismÃ¡tica personalidad y su historia de amor con la canadiense Kim Migneault. Su buen humor y su gran sonrisa son dos de sus mayores caracterÃ­sticas como creador de contenido.
Sin embargo, hace unos dÃ­as alertÃ³ a sus miles de seguidores cuando compartiÃ³ algunos videos desde un hospital y mencionÃ³ que serÃ­a intervenido de emergencia.
Por jugar "vencidas" el creador de contenido "Sonrixs" podrÃ­a perder la movilidad de su mano ðŸ˜Ÿ
â€” Centro Informativo QuerÃ©taro (@CIQueretaro)
Mediante un video compartido en su cuenta de TikTok, Sonrixs revelÃ³ que al estar jugando "vencidas o fuerzitas" su brazo se "rompiÃ³ en tres pedazos" y corre el riesgo de perder laâ€¦[pic.twitter.com/BBTFARNFj0][December 19, 2024]
Con el brazo enyesado y una voz frÃ¡gil, contÃ³:
Me van a operar, y es que pasÃ³ todo tan rÃ¡pido que aÃºn no lo logrÃ³ procesar. QuerÃ­a comunicÃ¡rselos porque mi dÃ­a a dÃ­a es estar aquÃ­, grabar y leerlosâ€.
Â¿Por quÃ© el influencer Sonrixs sufriÃ³ un accidente en su brazo?
La noticia impactÃ³ a sus seguidores pues la causa de su accidente seguÃ­a siendo un gran misterio, que no dejaban de preguntar en los comentarios quÃ© le habÃ­a sucedido.
Pasaron algunos dÃ­as hasta que el creador de contenido revelÃ³ cual habÃ­a sido el motivo de su accidente, mencionando que los dÃ­as que lleva en el hospital son derivados de la larga recuperaciÃ³n que le espera con clavos y una placa en el brazo, todo por jugar vencidas.
â€” MGM Noticias (@MgmPuebla)
